intro: Calyptrocalyx stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calyptrocalyx, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and distinctive calyptera, which are specialized structures that cover the base of the flower buds. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with five petals that are often pale in color. Calyptrocalyx stenophyllus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
